column4: I do like dd for imaging partitions.. increase the buffer size to speed it up.
the problem is that i've got a lot of free space on the drive
What link did you use to get that?
I use dd to copy and restore the mbr with and without the partition info
let me guess, you make a raw image with dd and then use zip to compress it?
yeah but for the whole drive i mean (not just mbr)
i've been told dd doesn't compress empty space

I was pointing out some of the possibilities..  I need to run...  dd can be piped to gzip per the link I gave earlier for a comp[ressed image, but junk that is not zeroed out will show up as data.. true
His problems are not with linux or ubuntu.. they start with wubi
Wubi uses a file to simulate a drive structure etc..   tries to contain it like that
also most likely need kernel-headers for your specific  uname -a   kernel
